headline.main: A Tea Party Darling's Offer on Social Security

docs.abstract: The conservative writer Friedrich Hayek, a favorite of libertarians, was encouraged to apply for Social Security by a prominent libertarian financier, Charles Koch.
docs.snippet: The conservative writer Friedrich Hayek, a favorite of libertarians, was encouraged to apply for Social Security by a prominent libertarian financier, Charles Koch.

docs.lead_paragraph: The writings of Friedrich Hayek, the 20th century free-market enthusiast and Nobel laureate, have long been a favorite of libertarians, who have used them to argue that government programs like Social Security and Medicare put the nation and its people on what Hayek called "The Road to Serfdom."

headline.main: A Tea Party Darling's Offer on Social Security

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House’s decision to seek a quick ruling on President Obama‘s landmark health care law will inject the controversial issue back into the nation’s political bloodstream at the height of the 2012 presidential campaign.

headline.main: Supreme Court Ruling Could Revive Health Care for 2012 Campaign

docs.abstract: On Wednesday, the administration agreed to seek a swift review of President Obama’s health care law by the Supreme Court.
